title.narrative: Strategies for Community Psychosocial Rehabilitation and Comprehensive Health in Colombia

description.narrative: This project aims to: contribute to the efforts of the Colombian government to guarantee community psychosocial rehabilitation and comprehensive health, as well as dialogue and consultation with vulnerable populations, particularly ethnic groups and victims of the armed conflict. This will be done through three objectives: i) strengthening the implementation of the Comprehensive Health and Psychosocial Care Program for Victims of the Armed Conflict (PAPSIVI), particularly within the framework of the ethnic module ; ii) advance in the implementation of Line 3 of the National Plan for Psychosocial Rehabilitation for Coexistence and Non-repetition, that is, the implementation of the Community Psychosocial Rehabilitation Strategy for Coexistence and Non-repetition (ERCPCNR); and iii) develop the following scenarios for dialogue and consultation: Health Subcommittee of the Permanent Consultation Board - MPC, Working Groups with the Roma people, the Raizal Council, meeting with the Third Commission of the National Space for Prior Consultation (ENCP) of black, Afro-Colombian, Raizales and Palenqueras (NARP) communities, and scenarios with victims of the armed conflict, in accordance with the transversal strategy of participation of the victims, established in the PAPSIVI, to the areas prioritized by the national psychosocial rehabilitation plan for the coexistence and non-repetition.
